name: 2016_08_humanities_student_major_233_makeuprehab
title: 2016-08-humanities-student-major_233_MakeupRehab.txt
content_scrubbed:
I just saw Temptalia[.] swatches for the new Viseart Bijoux Royal palette. It[.] pretty! It[.] totally my thing! In fact, it[.] so my thing that I already have a dupe for every single colour (the only iffy one might be that deep emerald shade, and it[.] still probably in either my Makeup Revolution Give Them Nightmares palette or one of my 88 palettes). I was looking at the swatches and going "that[.] Heartleaf or Aztec Gold, that[.] Medieval Haunting, that[.] Hotsy Totsy, that[.] Tutankhamun, that[.] @#$%!, pretty sure that colour is in Naked2...". It[.] getting surprisingly easy to do this now. (I'm not really sure where you can even get Viseart in Canada anyway.)

I haven't put on makeup in a couple of weeks because it[.] all packed up. My mom is getting the top floor of the house repainted and the bathroom renovated, so almost everything is stuffed away somewhere downstairs. 

I soon need to go through my makeup to figure out what[.] coming with me when I move back to the university dormitories (for what might be my last year, I may be graduating next spring). I won't have the excuse of getting up too early to apply it this semester since three days a week, my classes don't start until 11. 

Speaking of classes, in the span of one day, I was registered for three different math classes. I'm an ~~Arts~~ Humanities student (they *just* changed the faculty[.] name and I never remember it) but I still have a requirement of a quantitative course for graduation. The university also abruptly ended the math program I was in for financial reasons (which admittedly, doesn't give credit, it[.] a build-up program to reteach *everything* and as it had been a decade since I had done any math, it was very useful), so I've been bouncing around from course to course. I've finally registered for an algebra/trigonometry math course after getting a special waiver (because technically, I was ineligible for *any* low-level math courses until I finished the program - the math department is clearly still working out how to deal with everyone who was in said program), which is kind of an advanced version of the math course I just did so parts of it should be very familiar to me. In any case, other than that math course, I've ordered every required text I need. 13 novels/anthologies for about $65 - everything is secondhand (because trying to cite an ebook, as I found last semester, is extremely difficult).
